lead_paragraph: Atlanta Hawks guard Speedy Claxton is questionable for the beginning of the season after breaking a bone in his left hand. Claxton, who was injured during a workout Monday, was examined yesterday by Dr. Michael Bernot, a team physician, and will see the hand specialist Dr. Stephen McCollam today. Claxton, 28, was expected to be Atlanta’s starting point guard and signed a four-year, $25.5 million deal in July.
